thread.title: Times have changed: Every R1 line-up predicted
thread.title_full: Times have changed: Every R1 line-up predicted

title: Times have changed: Every R1 line-up predicted
text:
Majak the man to make mark 1:06 The predicted line-ups for every AFL club for Round 1, 2017 March 14, 2017 1:22pm Source: FOX SPORTS THE recent JLT Community Series threw up a variety of headaches for all 18 AFL coaches and match committees — both positive and negative. 
Unfortunately for some clubs, key players picked up untimely injuries, which consequently flipped many Round 1 plans on their head. 
For others, a host of young players shocked and impressed, making it difficult to ignore them for selection come the first round of the season. 
And for a few clubs, some players disappointed over the three weeks, leaving their chances of Round 1 selection in doubt. 
In January, foxfooty.com.au put together its best 22 for each club this year . 
But much has changed in two months. 
After a pre-season campaign that saw several injuries, form rises and form slumps, this is how your club could line up for the first weekend of the home and away season. 
Live stream EVERY game of the 2017 NAB AFL Women’s competition on FOX SPORTS. Get your free 2-week FOXTEL PLAY trial and start watching in minutes. SIGN UP NOW > 
ADELAIDE CROWS 
THE name on every South Australian of a Crows persuasion’s lips this past month has been Curtly Hampton . The former GWS Giant has been talked up by those both inside and outside the club after his first season in Adelaide was marred by a foot injury. The question is whether Hampton has earned a spot in the best 22 or if he will simply gain one while Rory Sloane (eye), Brad Crouch (hamstring) and Scott Thompson (shoulder) race to be available for Round 1. Of that trio, Sloane appears the most likely to play against GWS. 
B: Kyle Hartigan, Daniel Talia, Luke Brown 
HB: Brodie Smith, Jake Lever, Rory Laird 
C: Curtly Hampton , David Mackay, Rory Atkins 
HF: Mitch McGovern, Taylor Walker, Tom Lynch 
F: Eddie Betts, Josh Jenkins, Charlie Cameron 
FOLL: Sam Jacobs, Rory Sloane, Matt Crouch 
I/C: Richard Douglas, Kyle Cheney , Paul Seedsman, Cam Ellis-Yolmen 
EMG: Jake Kelly, Riley Knight, Wayne Milera 
OTHERS: Brad Crouch, Scott Thompson , Jordan Gallucci, Harrison Wigg, Andy Otten, Myles Poholke, Troy Menzel, Elliott Himmelberg, Matt Signorello, Dean Gore, Harry Dear, Tom Doedee, Ben Davis, Reilly O’Brien 
ROOKIES: Jonathon Beech, Hugh Greenwood, Paul Hunter, Alex Keath, Ben Jarman Josh Schache is hoping to be fit for Round 1. Picture: Peter Wallis Source: News Corp Australia 
BRISBANE LIONS 
RECRUITS at either end of the ground won’t be debuting in Brisbane’s Round 1 Q-Clash, with Jack Frost suspended and Hugh McCluggage set to miss a handful of weeks with an ankle injury. Josh Schache is also in doubt for Round 1 while Allen Christensen will miss a couple of months after another collarbone injury. That does open the door for youth to enter Chris Fagan’s side — but then that door was already pretty wide open. Eric Hipwood looks set to gain a spot in the side and could play at either end after proving he can fit in as a swingman. 
B: Ryan Harwood, Eric Hipwood , Darcy Gardiner 
HB: Daniel Rich, Harris Andrews, Tom Cutler 
C: Dayne Zorko, Mitch Robinson, Dayne Beams 
HF: Tom Bell, Josh Schache, Lewis Taylor 
F: Ben Keays , Michael Close, Daniel McStay 
FOLL: Stefan Martin, Tom Rockliff, Ryan Bastinac 
I/C: Ryan Lester, Rohan Bewick, Rhys Mathieson, Sam Mayes 
EMG: Marco Paparone, Jarrod Berry, Josh Walker 
OTHERS: Allen Christensen, Jack Frost, Hugh McCluggage , Jarrad Jansen, Claye Beams, Nick Robertson, Jacob Allison, Jake Barrett, Josh Clayton, Cedric Cox, Liam Dawson, Jonathan Freeman, Corey Lyons, Sam Skinner, Archie Smith, Alex Witherden 
ROOKIES: Matt Eagles, Blake Grewar, Matthew Hammelmann, Cian Hanley, Mitch Hinge, Oscar McInerney, Reuben William 
CARLTON 
AFTER bringing in yet more ex-Giants over the off-season, No. 1 pick Jacob Weitering may be forced to spend more time in the forward line in 2017. He looked good at that end of the ground at times during the JLT series. Jarrod Pickett may have forced his way into the team after kicking three goals in the Blues’ final hitout against Fremantle, while ex-Cat Billie Smedts could get an opportunity as well. 
B: Sam Docherty, Lachie Plowman, Simon White 
HB: Kade Simpson, Sam Rowe, Caleb Marchbank 
C: Ed Curnow, Patrick Cripps, Matthew Wright 
HF: Sam Kerridge, Jacob Weitering, Dale Thomas 
F: Jack Silvagni, Levi Casboult, Rhys Palmer 
FOLL: Matthew Kreuzer, Marc Murphy, Bryce Gibbs 
I/C: Dennis Armfield, Charlie Curnow, Billie Smedts , Jarrod Pickett 
EMG: Sam Petrevski-Seton, Nick Graham, Blaine Boekhorst 
OTHERS: Dylan Buckley , Liam Jones, Andrew Phillips, Liam Sumner, Jed Lamb, David Cuningham, Zac Fisher, Daniel Gorringe, Kristian Jaksch, Pat Kerr, Harrison Macreadie, Harry McKay, Cameron Polson, Alex Silvagni, Tom Williamson 
ROOKIES: Ciaran Byrne, Andrew Gallucci, Jesse Glass-McCasker, Billy Gowers, Matthew Korcheck, Kym LeBois, Ciaran Sheehan Key Pies missing at training 0:27 
COLLINGWOOD 
TWO of Collingwood’s biggest off-season inclusions are set to miss Round 1. Daniel Wells is on the injury list, as Pies fans feared when he was recruited, while Fox Sports’ Jake Niall reported recently that Chris Mayne is on the outer of the best 22. That’s something Nathan Buckley didn’t deny on AFL Tonight last week when he simply said Mayne was “in the mix”. That may open the door for Tom Phillips , who led the Magpies with 62 disposals over the JLT series, while Henry Schade has provided Buckley with an extra option as a tall defender. In turn that could see Lachie Keeffe play up forward. 
B: Lynden Dunn, Ben Reid, Brayden Maynard 
HB: Travis Varcoe, Henry Schade , Jeremy Howe 
C: Steele Sidebottom, Scott Pendlebury, James Aish 
HF: Tom Phillips , Lachie Keeffe, Jordan De Goey 
F: Jamie Elliott, Darcy Moore, Alex Fasolo 
FOLL: Brodie Grundy, Adam Treloar, Taylor Adams 
I/C: Jarryd Blair, Jack Crisp, Levi Greenwood, Will Hoskin-Elliott 
EMG: Mason Cox, Jesse White, Chris Mayne 
OTHERS: Daniel Wells , Tom Langdon, Adam Oxley, Matthew Scharenberg, Ben Sinclair, Tyson Goldsack, Tim Broomhead, Ben Crocker, Josh Daicos, Kayle Kirby, Sam McLarty, Jackson Ramsey, Josh Smith, Brayden Sier, Rupert Wills, Callum Brown 
ROOKIES: Max Lynch, Liam Mackie, Mitch McCarthy, Josh Thomas 
ESSENDON 
FIRST-CHOICE ruckman Matthew Leuenberger went down with a hamstring injury in the final week of the JLT series against Geelong and looks likely to miss Round 1. Combined with Tom Bellchambers’ knee injury, that has opened the door for Shaun McKernan . David Myers will miss the opening few rounds with a finger injury — and there’s certainly competition for his spot and others’. 
B: Mark Baguley, Michael Hartley, Patrick Ambrose 
HB: Andrew McGrath, Michael Hurley, Brendon Goddard 
C: David Zaharakis, Dyson Heppell, Brent Stanton 
HF: Darcy Parish, Cale Hooker, Anthony McDonald-Tipungwuti 
F: Orazio Fantasia, Joe Daniher, Travis Colyer 
FOLL: Shaun McKernan , Jobe Watson, Zach Merrett 
I/C: Kyle Langford, Martin Gleeson , Heath Hocking, James Kelly 
EMG: Ben Howlett, Mitch Brown, James Stewart 
OTHERS: Matthew Leuenberger, Tom Bellchambers, David Myers , Aaron Francis, Josh Begley, Dylan Clarke, Josh Green, Alex Morgan, Kobe Mutch, Mason Redman, Jordan Ridley, Craig Bird, Jayden Laverde, Jackson Merrett, Matt Dea, Conor McKenna 
ROOKIES: Sam Draper, Yestin Eades, Jake Long, Shaun McKernan, Ben McNiece Shaun McKernan had an impressive JLT Community Series. Source: Getty Images 
FREMANTLE 
THE last week of the pre-season brought bad news for the Dockers, with Hayden Ballantyne set to miss 8-10 weeks after a hamstring injury. There’s also no timeline on Harley Bennell’s return from a calf complaint — given the current situation for H. Bs at Fremantle, we’d be concerned if we were Harley Balic. The flow-on effects of those two absences should see top draft pick Griffin Logue in the best 22 for Round 1, though. 
B: Lee Spurr, Michael Johnson, Alex Pearce 
HB: Tom Sheridan, Joel Hamling, Garrick Ibbotson 
C: Bradley Hill, Nat Fyfe, Stephen Hill 
HF: Lachie Weller, Cam McCarthy, Connor Blakely 
F: Hayden Crozier, Shane Kersten, Michael Walters 
FOLL: Aaron Sandilands, David Mundy, Lachie Neale 
I/C: Cam Sutcliffe, Matt Taberner , Danyle Pearce, Griffin Logue 
EMG: Harley Balic, Ed Langdon, Sam Collins 
OTHERS: Hayden Ballantyne, Harley Bennell , Michael Apeness, Zac Dawson, Nick Suban, Zac Clarke, Darcy Tucker, Brennan Cox, Sean Darcy, Brady Grey, Jon Griffin, Ethan Hughes, Luke Ryan 
ROOKIES: Josh Deluca-Cardillo, Taylin Duman, Ryan Nyhuis, Luke Strnadica, Matthew Uebergang 
GEELONG CATS 
HOW do you solve a problem like Harry? Fortunately for Chris Scott, trying to pick whether to throw Harry Taylor forward or keep him in defence isn’t the toughest decision any AFL coach will have to make this season. That is one of just many small issues that could have a big impact on the Cats in 2017. Other concerns include whether they’re still too tall with Mark Blicavs, Zac Smith and Rhys Stanley all likely in the best 22, and whether recruits Brandan Parfitt and Tom Stewart can earn spots. 
B: Lachie Henderson, Tom Lonergan, Jackson Thurlow 
HB: Zach Tuohy, Harry Taylor, Andrew Mackie 
C: Cam Guthrie, Joel Selwood, Mark Blicavs 
HF: Nakia Cockatoo, Aaron Black, Steven Motlop 
F: Daniel Menzel, Tom Hawkins, Lincoln McCarthy 
FOLL: Zac Smith, Patrick Dangerfield, Mitch Duncan 
I/C: Rhys Stanley, Sam Menegola, Jed Bews, Darcy Lang 
EMG: Jordan Murdoch, Brandan Parfitt, Tom Ruggles 
OTHERS: Scott Selwood, Cory Gregson, Jake Kolodjashnij, Wylie Buzza, Matthew Hayball, Esava Ratugolea, Josh Cowan, Quinton Narkle, Timm House, Jordan Cunico, George Horlin-Smith, Tom Stewart, Ryan Abbott 
ROOKIES: James Parsons, Jack Henry, Zach Guthrie, Jamaine Jones, Mark O’Connor, Sam Simpson 
GOLD COAST SUNS 
THE Suns appear to be in relatively healthy shape heading into 2017 and that is reflected with a small injury list. Jarrod Harbrow will have to prove his form and fitness in the NEAFL after recovering from an ankle injury, while Trent McKenzie (calf) will also be hard-pressed to work his way into Rodney Eade’s team. Jack Bowes and Ben Ainsworth are two youngsters with ample talent that look to have done enough over the pre-season. 
B: Adam Saad, Rory Thompson, Jack Bowes 
HB: Kade Kolodjashnij, Steven May, Jack Martin 
C: Pearce Hanley, David Swallow, Matt Rosa 
HF: Aaron Hall, Tom Lynch, Jesse Lonergan 
F: Will Brodie , Peter Wright, Callum Ah Chee 
FOLL: Jarrod Witts, Michael Barlow, Gary Ablett 
I/C: Jarryd Lyons, Ben Ainsworth , Touk Miller, Alex Sexton 
EMG: Jesse Joyce, Tom Nicholls, Brayden Fiorini 
OTHERS: Michael Rischitelli, Jarrod Harbrow , Sam Day , Brandon Matera, Trent McKenzie, Dan Currie, Jarrad Grant, Mitch Hallahan, Jesse Joyce, Sean Lemmens, Jack Leslie, Brad Scheer, Josh Schoenfeld, Jack Scrimshaw, Matt Shaw, Mackenzie Willis 
ROOKIES: Keegan Brooksby, Ryan Davis, Cameron Loersch, Darcy MacPherson, Max Spencer Coniglio to miss six weeks 0:27 
GWS GIANTS 
THE arguable premiership favourites will go into Round 1 clearly without key members of their best 22. With no timeframe on his return from a calf injury, veteran recruit Brett Deledio will miss Round 1, while Stephen Coniglio will miss six weeks with a sindesmosis injury. And with Lachie Whitfield also out of the first few months due to suspension, there are plenty of spots for some of the Giants’ young guns to take. Tim Taranto impressed during the JLT series and slots straight onto a half-forward flank, while Matthew Kennedy , who picked up 17, 17 and 22 touches respectively in his three pre-season games, also comes in alongside namesake Adam Kennedy . 
B: Matt Buntine, Phil Davis, Nick Haynes 
HB: Heath Shaw, Adam Tomlinson, Zac Williams 
C: Tom Scully, Ryan Griffen, Josh Kelly 
HF: Tim Taranto , Jeremy Cameron, Toby Greene 
F: Steve Johnson, Jon Patton, Devon Smith 
FOLL: Shane Mumford, Callan Ward, Dylan Shiel 
I/C: Rory Lobb, Matthew Kennedy, Adam Kennedy , Nathan Wilson 
EMG: Jacob Hopper, Matt De Boer, Will Setterfield 
OTHERS: Lachie Whitfield, Brett Deledio, Stephen Coniglio , Aidan Corr, Isaac Cumming, Tom Downie, Jeremy Finlayson, Matthew Flynn, Harrison Himmelberg, Tim Mohr, Harry Perryman, Dawson Simpson, Lachlan Tiziani 
ROOKIES: Daniel Lloyd, Sam Reid, Tendai Mzungu, Zach Sproule, Jake Stein 
HAWTHORN 
AFTER playing all three JLT Community Series games, Ryan Schoenmakers surely comes into the side after being named as an emergency in January. Brendan Whitecross had limited game time in just two matches, so he looms as the logical replacement for Schoenmakers. Will Langford had an excellent pre-season and gets a reprieve ahead of Luke Hodge , who won’t be out there in Round 1 due to a club-imposed suspension, but is still obviously part of the best 22. 
B: Taylor Duryea, James Frawley, Ben Stratton 
HB: Grant Birchall, Josh Gibson, Shaun Burgoyne 
C: Liam Shiels, Will Langford , Isaac Smith 
HF: Paul Puopolo, Jarryd Roughead, Cyril Rioli 
F: Luke Breust, Jack Gunston, James Sicily 
FOLL: Ben McEvoy, Jaeger O’Meara, Tom Mitchell 
I/C: Billy Hartung, Tyrone Vickery, Ricky Henderson, Ryan Schoenmakers 
EMG: Brendan Whitecross , Teia Miles, Ryan Burton 
OTHERS: Luke Hodge , Dan Howe, Kaiden Brand, Jon Ceglar, Blake Hardwick, Kurt Heatherley, Mitchell Lewis, Kieran Lovell, Harry Morrison, Tim O’Brien, Jono O’Rourke, Marc Pittonet, Dallas Willsmore 
ROOKIES: James Cousins, Jack Fitzpatrick, Conor Glass, Oliver Hanrahan, Kade Stewart, Luke Surman 
MELBOURNE 
SELECTING Melbourne’s best 22 is no easy task, especially given its plethora of running half-backs. Jake Melksham was strong throughout the JLT Series, while fellow ex-Bomber Michael Hibberd is in some doubt after having his foot stomped on at training. Sam Weiderman and Jack Watts complement Jesse Hogan in a vibrant forward line that is also likely to include Christian Petracca and Jeff Garlett. Dean Kent is still struggling with a back complaint after an interrupted pre-season. 
B: Jayden Hunt, Tom McDonald, Neville Jetta 
HB: Christian Salem, Oscar McDonald, Bernie Vince 
C: Dom Tyson, Jordan Lewis, Billy Stretch 
HF: Christian Petracca, Jack Watts, Jeff Garlett 
F: Sam Weiderman , Jesse Hogan, Angus Brayshaw 
FOLL: Max Gawn, Nathan Jones, Jack Viney 
I/C: James Harmes , Clayton Oliver, Tom Bugg, Jake Melksham 
EMG: Jake Spencer, Ben Kennedy, Alex Neal-Bullen 
OTHERS: Dean Kent , Michael Hibberd , Jack Trengove, Cam Pederson, Sam Frost, Mitch Hannan, Colin Garland, Aaron Vandenberg, Jay Kennedy-Harris, Liam Hulett, Alex Neal-Bullen, Mitch King, Dion Johnstone, Pat McKenna, Josh Wagner 
ROOKIES: Tim Smith, Mitch White, Joel Smith, Declan Keilty, Lachlan Filipovic, Corey Maynard 
NORTH MELBOURNE 
INJURIES have forced most of the changes to North Melbourne’s best 22, but a few form rises and drops have also contributed. Mason Wood (hamstring), Jed Anderson (shoulder) and Ben Jacobs (foot) are all unavailable for Round 1 due to injury, while Ben Cunnington also has to serve a suspension for rough conduct. Enter young duo Ed Vickers-Willis and Mitch Hibberd , who both played all three JLT games and impressed throughout various stages. Sam Wright is finally fit, so he comes in, while Trent Dumont’s ability to accumulate possessions throughout the pre-season sees him cement his spot. The big dilemma surrounds the big man battle between Braydon Preuss and Majak Daw — and we’ve given the nod to soon-to-be-upgraded rookie Preuss, due to his ability to hit the scoreboard and influence more ruck contests over the summer. 
B: Jamie Macmillan, Scott Thompson, Luke McDonald 
HB: Ed Vickers-Willis , Robbie Tarrant, Marley Williams 
C: Shaun Atley, Jack Ziebell, Trent Dumont 
HF: Shaun Higgins, Jarrad Waite, Nathan Hrovat 
F: Kayne Turner, Ben Brown, Lindsay Thomas 
FOLL: Todd Goldstein, Andrew Swallow, Sam Gibson 
I/C: Ryan Clarke, Braydon Preuss , Mitch Hibberd, Sam Wright 
EMG: Jy Simpkin, Majak Daw , Taylor Garner 
OTHERS: Ben Cunnington, Ben Jacobs, Jed Anderson, Mason Wood , Paul Ahern, Nick Larkey, Ben McKay, Declan Mountford, Daniel Nielson, Corey Wagner, Declan Watson, Josh Williams, Sam Durdin, Lachie Hansen, Aaron Mullett 
ROOKIES: Will Fordham, Oscar Junker, Matthew Taylor, Cameron Zurhaar North Melbourne’s Majak Daw could be on the outer of the best 22. Picture: Wayne Ludbey Source: News Corp Australia 
PORT ADELAIDE 
A FAIR few changes to Port’s best 22 since January, primarily due to the emergence of two draftees. Sam Powell-Pepper has rocketed into contention thanks to an impressive JLT Community Series campaign, highlighted by his brilliant ‘don’t argue’ on Shaun Burgoyne . In the same game, rookie Brett Eddy — who should be upgraded to the senior lost before Round 1 — booted 5.4 in a damaging display. They’re both in for Round 1. Jasper Pittard , the club’s most improved player in 2016, will miss Round 1 with a hamstring injury, meaning Tom Clurey should come in. Jake Neade (limited JLT game time) and Nathan Krakouer (suspension) won’t be out there. 
B: Matthew Broadbent, Jack Hombsch, Tom Clurey 
HB: Darcy Byrne-Jones, Jackson Trengove, Hamish Hartlett 
C: Brad Ebert, Travis Boak, Jared Polec 
HF: Angus Monfries, Justin Westhoff, Aaron Young 
F: Brett Eddy , Charlie Dixon, Chad Wingard 
FOLL: Paddy Ryder, Ollie Wines, Robbie Gray 
I/C: Sam Powell-Pepper , Sam Gray, Tom Jonas, Jarman Impey 
EMG: Matt Lobbe, Karl Amon, Matt White 
OTHERS: Jake Neade, Jasper Pittard , Jimmy Toumpas, Todd Marshall, Billy Frampton, Logan Austin, Riley Bonner, Willem Drew, Joe Atley, Aidyn Johnson, Dougal Howard, Jesse Palmer, Brendon Ah Chee, Nathan Krakouer 
ROOKIES: Will Snelling, Peter Ladhams, Jarrod Lienert, Dan Houston, Cameron Hewett, Emmanuel Irra 
RICHMOND 
THE hugely popular Toby Nankervis looks set to shoulder Richmond’s ruck responsibilities, with Shaun Hampson (back) placed on the club’s long-term injury list. Despite this, it’s arguable the former Swan had already gone past Hampson as the club’s preferred ruck. Ivan Maric has played in two JLT matches, but didn’t set the world on fire. Richmond could either bring in another runner to replace Hampson, or opt to upgrade a rookie such as Mabior Chol to take his spot. 
B: Nick Vlastuin, Alex Rance, Dylan Grimes 
HB: Brandon Ellis, David Astbury, Bachar Houli 
C: Josh Caddy, Dustin Martin, Shaun Grigg 
HF: Daniel Rioli, Jack Riewoldt, Shane Edwards 
F: Sam Lloyd, Ben Griffiths, Oleg Markov 
FOLL: Toby Nankervis, Trent Cotchin, Dion Prestia 
I/C: Jayden Short, Corey Ellis, Anthony Miles, Reece Conca 
EMG: Dan Butler, Kamdyn McIntosh, Kane Lambert 
OTHERS: Shaun Hampson , Jake Batchelor, Shai Bolton, Nathan Broad, Nathan Drummond, Todd Elton, Ryan Garthwaite, Jack Graham, Taylor Hunt, Ben Lennon, Ivan Maric, Connor Menadue, Steven Morris, Jacob Townsend 
ROOKIES: Jason Castagna, Mabior Chol, Callum Moore, Ivan Soldo, Tyson Stengle Toby Nankervis has impressed for Richmond in 2017 to date. Picture: Wayne Ludbey Source: News Corp Australia 
ST KILDA 
ALAN Richardson’s men are close to full strength, with Leigh Montagna (calf) the only question mark heading into Round 1. Billy Longer looked to have taken the No. 1 ruck mantle from Tom Hickey, but Hickey may have done enough to retain his spot after a best on ground performance against the Swans on Sunday. Youngsters Hugh Goddard (Achilles) and Nathan Freeman (knee/hip) are still recovering from their respective injuries. But otherwise it’s all systems go for the team many consider a finals contender for the first time in a long time. 
B: Jarryn Geary, Sean Dempster, Sam Gilbert 
HB: Shane Savage, Jake Carlisle, Jack Newnes 
C: Seb Ross, Jack Steven, Leigh Montagna 
HF: Mav Weller, Nick Riewoldt, Jack Billings 
F: Tim Membrey, Josh Bruce, Paddy McCartin 
FOLL: Tom Hickey, David Armitage, Blake Acres 
I/C: Jack Steele, Dylan Roberton, Luke Dunstan, Jade Gresham 
EMG: Nathan Freeman, Jack Lonie, Nathan Brown 
OTHERS: Koby Stevens, Jack Sinclair, Daniel McKenzie, Hugh Goddard, Billy Longer, Ben Long, Josh Battle, Jimmy Webster, Ed Phillips, Brandon White, Nathan Wright, Bailey Rice, Darren Minchington, Lewis Pierce, Jason Holmes 
ROOKIES: Nick O’Kearney, Nick Coughlan, Darragh Joyce, Ray Connellan, Rowan Marshall 
SYDNEY 
THINGS aren’t looking so good in the Swans’ health department, with a number of grand final players set to miss Round 1. Isaac Heeney is out indefinitely with glandular fever, veterans Jarrad McVeigh and Kieren Jack are fighting a race against the clock to be fit, while T om Papley and Gary Rohan are on the club’s long-term injury list. 
B: Nick Smith, Heath Grundy, Zak Jones 
HB: Aliir Aliir, Dane Rampe, Jeremy Laidler 
C: Jake Lloyd, Dan Hannebery, Callum Mills 
HF: Dean Towers , Lance Franklin, George Hewett 
F: Sam Reid, Kurt Tippett, Dan Robinson 
FOLL: Sam Naismith, Josh Kennedy, Luke Parker 
I/C: Jordan Foote , Harry Cunningham, Ollie Florent , Harrison Marsh 
EMG: Callum Sinclair, James Rose, Nic Newman 
OTHERS: Tom Papley, Jarrad McVeigh, Kieren Jack, Gary Rohan, Isaac Heeney , Alex Johnson, Will Hayward, Darcy Cameron, Jack Maibaum, Tyrone Leonardis, Jordan Dawson, Michael Talia, Brandon Jack 
ROOKIES: Shaun Edwards, Ben Ronke, Colin O’Riordan, Robbie Fox, Lewis Melican, Sam Fisher, Sam Murray, Toby Pink Lycett goes down 0:37 
WEST COAST 
TWO big men out, two big men in. The Eagles’ ruck stocks took a massive hit when Nic Naitanui (ACL) and Scott Lycett (PCL) went down with knee injuries late last year. Lycett returned to play for East Perth on Sunday, but dislocated his shoulder, further complicating the matter. Recruits Nathan Vardy and Drew Petrie look set to debut for their new club as a result, with Petrie set to be upgraded from the rookie list. 
B: Tom Barrass, Will Schofield, Shannon Hurn 
HB: Sharrod Wellingham, Jeremy McGovern, Brad Sheppard 
C: Andrew Gaff, Sam Mitchell, Chris Masten 
HF: Elliot Yeo, Jack Darling, Mark LeCras 
F: Jamie Cripps, Josh Kennedy, Josh Hill 
FOLL: Nathan Vardy , Matt Priddis, Luke Shuey 
I/C: Mark Hutchings, Dom Sheed, Drew Petrie , Lewis Jetta 
EMG: Liam Duggan, Jack Redden, Eric Mackenzie 
OTHERS: Nic Naitanui, Scott Lycett , Matthew Allen, Sam Butler, Tom Cole, Jonathan Giles, Malcolm Karpany, Tom Lamb, Kurt Mutimer, Jackson Nelson, Luke Partington, Willie Rioli, Josh Rotham, Daniel Venables, Jake Waterman 
ROOKIES: Tarir Bayok, Paddy Brophy, Tom Gorter, Fraser McInnes, Jordan Snadden, Simon Tunbridge, Francis Watson 
WESTERN BULLDOGS 
INJURIES continue to plague the premiers, who will be without Jordan Roughead (hamstring), Tom Campbell (ankle) and possibly Tory Dickson for Round 1. Roarke Smith (ACL) is gone for the season, while Jack Redpath (ACL) and Mitch Wallis (broken leg) are still some way off. While there were doubts whether premiership Magpie Travis Cloke would be a lock for the club’s Round 1 match against his former side, a commanding JLT series has him inked in. 
B: Matthew Boyd, Dale Morris, Shane Biggs 
HB: Jason Johannisen, Easton Wood, Robert Murphy 
C: Lachie Hunter, Jack Macrae, Matt Suckling 
HF: Jake Stringer, Stewart Crameri, Liam Picken 
F: Travis Cloke , Luke Dalhaus, Caleb Daniel 
FOLL: Tom Boyd, Marcus Bontempelli, Tom Liberatore 
I/C: Tory Dickson, Clay Smith, Toby McLean , Josh Dunkley 
EMG: Fletcher Roberts, Marcus Adams, Tim English 
OTHERS: Jordan Roughead , Tom Campbell, Jack Redpath, Mitch Wallis , Lukas Webb, Mitch Honeychurch, Declan Hamilton, Patrick Lipinski, Fergus Greene, Bailey Dale, Kieran Collins, Lewis Young, Bailey Williams, Lin Jong, Zaine Cordy 
ROOKIES: Josh Prudden, Bradley Lynch, Roarke Smith, Nathan Mullenger-McHugh, Tristan Tweedie View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
